strategy: Use LightGBM with these exact settings: num_boost_round=100, learning_rate=0.1, max_depth=6. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median and drop columns with more than 50% missing values. Use LightGBM's built-in categorical feature handling by specifying categorical_feature parameter. If you encounter a dtype error, ensure categorical columns are cast to str.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Handle NaN values: fill numeric columns with median, drop columns with >50% missing
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Identify categorical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Convert categorical columns to string (in case of dtype issues)
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Prepare datasets for LightGBM
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train)
test_data = X_test

# Define LightGBM parameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'binary_logloss',
    'num_boost_round': 100,
    'learning_rate': 0.1,
    'max_depth': 6,
    'feature_fraction': 0.8,
    'bagging_fraction': 0.8,
    'bagging_freq': 5,
    'verbose': -1
}

# Train model
model = lgb.train(params, train_data, valid_sets=[train_data], early_stopping_rounds=10)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(test_data)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Handle NaN values: fill numeric columns with median, drop columns with more than 50% missing
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Identify categorical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Convert categorical columns to string (in case of dtype issues)
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Prepare datasets for LightGBM
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train)

# Define LightGBM parameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'binary_logloss',
    'num_boost_round': 100,
    'learning_rate': 0.1,
    'max_depth': 6,
    'feature_fraction': 0.8,
    'bagging_fraction': 0.8,
    'bagging_freq': 5,
    'verbose': -1
}

# Train model
model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Ensure Survived is rounded to 0 or 1
submission_df['Survived'] = (submission_df['Survived'] >= 0.5).astype(int)

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Drop columns with high missingness (more than 50%)
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_cols] = X_train[numeric_cols].fillna(X_train[numeric_cols].median())
X_test[numeric_cols] = X_test[numeric_cols].fillna(X_test[numeric_cols].median())

# Encode categorical variables using one-hot encoding (since LightGBM's categorical_feature doesn't work well with raw strings here)
categorical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)

# Align columns (ensure same column names)
X_train, X_test = X_train.align(X_test, join='inner', axis=1)

# Prepare datasets for LightGBM
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train)

# Define LightGBM parameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'binary_logloss',
    'num_boost_round': 100,
    'learning_rate': 0.1,
    'max_depth': 6,
    'verbose': -1
}

# Train model
model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Round predictions to 0 or 1
submission_df['Survived'] = (submission_df['Survived'] >= 0.5).astype(int)

# Save submission
submission_df.to_cs

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Drop columns with high missingness (more than 50%)
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_cols] = X_train[numeric_cols].fillna(X_train[numeric_cols].median())
X_test[numeric_cols] = X_test[numeric_cols].fillna(X_test[numeric_cols].median())

# Encode categorical variables using one-hot encoding
categorical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)

# Align columns to ensure consistency
X_train, X_test = X_train.align(X_test, join='inner', axis=1)

# Prepare datasets for LightGBM
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train)

# Define LightGBM parameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'binary_logloss',
    'num_boost_round': 100,
    'learning_rate': 0.1,
    'max_depth': 6,
    'verbose': -1
}

# Train model
model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Round predictions to 0 or 1
submission_df['Survived'] = (submission_df['Survived'] >= 0.5).astype(int)

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_cols] = X_train[numeric_cols].fillna(X_train[numeric_cols].median())
X_test[numeric_cols] = X_test[numeric_cols].fillna(X_test[numeric_cols].median())

# Encode categorical variables manually with clean column names
categorical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Create dummy variables
X_train_encoded = X_train.copy()
X_test_encoded = X_test.copy()

for col in categorical_cols:

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_cols] = X_train[numeric_cols].fillna(X_train[numeric_cols].median())
X_test[numeric_cols] = X_test[numeric_cols].fillna(X_test[numeric_cols].median())

# Only keep relevant categorical columns: Sex and Embarked
categorical_cols = ['Sex', 'Embarked']

# Encode Sex and Embarked
X_train_encoded = X_train.copy()
X_test_encoded = X_test.copy()

for col in categorical_cols:
    dummies = pd.get_dummies(X_train[col], prefix=col, prefix_sep='_', dummy_na=False)
    X_train_encoded = pd.concat([X_train_encoded, dummies], axis=1)
    dummies_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test[col], prefix=col, prefix_sep='_', dummy_na=False)
    X_test_encoded = pd.concat([X_test_encoded, dummies_test], axis=1)

# Drop original categorical columns
X_train_encoded = X_train_encoded.drop(columns=categorical_cols)
X_test_encoded = X_test_encoded.drop(columns=categorical_cols)

# Align columns
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='inner', axis=1)

# Train a simple model (Logistic Regression)
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Train model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=1000)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict_proba(X_test_encoded)[:, 1]
